title: Strengthening multi-agency public protection arrangements
abstract: Commissioned by the Home Office, this study examined the effectiveness of MAPPA after the Criminal Justice and Court Services Act (2000). The Act and subsequent legislation was designed to ensure greater consistency in the risk assessment and management of sexual and violent offenders. The study is significant insofar as it has influenced areas of national and local MAPPA policy. The results of the study were reported at a number of high profile conferences and form the basis of several chapters by Kemshall and Wood
